resources.string: The Most Scariest Place in Indonesia

I am a 6th semester Computer Science student at Institute Technology of Kalimantan, I\'ve been in love to programming since I was writing my first program back when I was in vocational school, I remember wasting a lot of time back then just to trying different tags and tutorials on google. Ever since that time I knew programming itâ€™s something that I like. \n This passion brings me through learning about solving real-world problem using technology as solution. Until I was participated in technology-based competition like Hackathon, at this competition really challenge my programming skills and communication skills. I was responsible for the development of an Android Mobile App this bring me to opportunity to learn about connecting android app and API. Beside of that I also have interest in Python programming, which I use for my last project about Sentiment Analysis from twitter about COVID-19 in Indonesia. \n I hoped that someday I will be working as software engineer, but there certainly more things that I really want to learn, so I am really excited and burning with motivation for learning not just about programming but also about life in general.
